newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Bhoja to buy YAKs from Lithuanian Airlines.
newsitem.headline: Bhoja to buy YAKs from Lithuanian Airlines.

text.p: Lithuanian Airlines (LAL) expects to sign an agreement in July to sell 11 YAK 42 aircraft to Pakistan's Bhoja after experts evaluate the planes in June, a LAL official said on Wednesday.
"The company that is going to buy the aircraft is Bhoja Airline Pvt," Eugenijus Skerstonas, adviser to the director general of LAL, told Reuters. "They will buy 11 YAK 42 aircraft."
"A purchase agreement should be signed on July 30," Skerstonas said. "On June 9, the Pakistani company will send technical experts who will examine and evaluate the aircraft."
On May 21, LAL and Bhoja signed an extension to a lease on two of the YAK 42s, Skerstonas said.
"The Pakistani company has leased these aircraft for several years," Skersontas said.
The deal will shed the last of LAL's Soviet-built aircraft.
The state-run airline, which has been slated for privatisation, currently has a fleet of three Boeing 737s, one SAAB 340, and a Set Star 731. It expects to acquire another SAAB later this year.
